alerts.issue_title: Potential Allergy Conflict: Acetaminophen and Liver Complaint
alerts.message: Patient has a 'Liver complaint' allergy. Dolo-Crosine (generic: Acetaminophen Extended) is hepatotoxic and should be used with extreme caution or an alternative considered in patients with liver issues. The prescribed dosage of 654mg twice daily (1308mg/day) warrants careful review.
alerts.suggested_action: Consult with the prescribing physician to review Dolo-Crosine (Acetaminophen) for a patient with a liver complaint. Consider an alternative pain relief medication or a lower, carefully monitored dose with liver function tests.
